channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for ME
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for ME

item.title: Report X-2023031175
item.description:
Report X-2023031175

  • Incident Date: 2023-03-22
  • City: AUBURN
  • State: ME
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: UPON UNLOADING THE TRAILER, UNLOADER FOUND DISCOLORATION TO BOTTOM OF BOX. RESPONDER CALLED FOR CLEAN UP, UPON INSPECTION, RESPONDER FOUND CANS DENTED CAUSING CRACKS AND CONTENTS TO SPRAY OUT INTO BOX.

item.title: Report I-2023030063
item.description:
Report I-2023030063

  • Incident Date: 2023-02-27
  • City: EXETER
  • State: ME
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: DHL EXPRESS (USA), INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On 02/27/2023 this dangerous goods shipment was reported as showing signs of Ieaking contents. Upon further inspection a leak was discovered at the opening of one of the drums. This incident occurred at the DHL LEJ Hub, Hermann-Koehl-Strasse 1 SCHKEUDITZ,Leipzig, 04435 Germany. Transportation by air has been confirmed.

item.title: Report E-2023030112
item.description:
Report E-2023030112

Identified by scraper @ 2023-04-03T15:59:55+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-02-02
  • City: portland
  • State: ME
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: CLEAN HARBORS ENVIRONMENTAL SERVICES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: Drum of material was placed onto liftgate which was then raised in order to transfer drum to the truck. The employee lost control of the drum, which fell off the truck onto the pavement. The drum landed on the top rim, denting the drum and partially dislodging the lid and releasing approximately 10-15 gallons of material. The release was quickly contained, absorbed and placed into a suitable salvage drum along with damaged container and it's remaining contents. The material was then shipped to the original destination facility without further incident. The incident was resolved within a short time, less than an hour.

item.title: Report X-2023020366
item.description:
Report X-2023020366

  • Incident Date: 2023-02-03
  • City: BIDDEFORD
  • State: ME
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Driver found package in vehicle while delivering, found package leaking, unsure of what happened. Driver mentions contents were frozen. Contents wasn't frozen by the time QA process package. DescribePack: Punctured bottom rear left side if looking at the barcode label. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Placed in red hazmat bin.
